newsitem.title: HONG KONG: CKI to invest in Sichuan ringroad - paper.
newsitem.headline: CKI to invest in Sichuan ringroad - paper.

text.p: Cheung Kong Infrastructure Holdings Ltd has signed a letter of intent to invest in an outer ringroad at Chengdu city of China's Sichuan province, the Beijing-backed Wen Wei Po daily said on Tuesday.
The 80-km long road involved a total investment of 2.0 billion yuan, the newspaper quoted director Liu Zhongshan of Sichuan's Communications Department as saying.
Cheung Kong Infrastructure officials were not immediately available for comment.
Liu said the Chinese side intended to take a co-operation format to jointly invest in the project with Cheung Kong Infrastructure because this would allow more flexibility in profit sharing.
He added the department would hold further discussions with the company on Tuesday, the newspaper said.
